intro: Pachychilus chinensis, commonly known as the Chinese pachychilus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to China and is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form with glossy, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, which bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially available.
